result.markdown:
# Introduction

This is a book created from markdown and executable code.

See @knuth84 for additional discussion of literate programming.

Markdown\index{Markdown} allows you to write using
an easy-to-read, easy-to-write plain text format.

For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see @fig-polar.

::: {.cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![A line plot on a polar axis](intro_files/figure-html/fig-polar-output-1.png){#fig-polar width=450 height=439}
:::
:::
